article.class: post-type-page post-2 page type-page status-publish hentry

section.p: The Board of Education Meeting scheduled for Monday April 13, 2020 at 7:00 PM will be held using an online meeting format. Follow the live stream by clicking here:
Persons wishing to make public comment during the meeting may do so by submitting your full name, home address and comments to the following email address: comment@crestlinebulldogs.org

Beginning Wednesday April 15, 2020, we will be handing out meals to families two days per week, Mondays and Wednesday. The times will remain the same: 11-1 PM and 3-4 PM. Families will receive two days’ worth of meals on Monday and three days’ worth of meals on Wednesday. Backpacks will continue to be distributed on Friday each week.

p.span: Please reach out to Mr. Henderson if you have questions or concerns. He can be reached at
or by phone at 419 683-3647. Email is the preferred method of contact at this time and would receive the quickest response.
You can also communicate via the district Facebook page or by direct message through Mr. Henderson’s Twitter by following @Crestline_Super.

**If you have a student that will be entering preschool, kindergarten, 7th or 12th grade, your student may need required immunizations. You will have at least 10 options in August to get your student ready for back-to-school. For questions, or to schedule an appointment, call (419)562-5871. (Appointments will help ensure your wait time is kept to a minimum.)**

a.span: School Fee Schedule For the 2019-2020 School Year

span.span: Changes to school calendar for the 2019-2020 school year:

a.span: Click Here to view the REVISED Calendar!

p.span: “The Crestline Exempted Village School District will provide a positive learning environment that will allow all students to be life-long learners and socially responsible citizens, able to communicate and lead with confidence in an ever changing world.”

hr.span: Last Updated on April 11th, 2020 at 08:43 am

Photos & Credits:
This website meets many internationally recognized web standards and is designed to be viewed on every modern browser.
Our site contains photos with various licensing terms.
*Parents of children, who attend schools that receive Title I, Part A funding, have the right to request and receive information about the qualifications of the educators who teach their children core subjects—reading, English language arts and mathematics.
